item.title: Advent of Code 2019
item.description: The Advent of Code 2019 has my thoughts about the daily exercises which I’m currently attempting to solve with both Go and Python 3.

item.title: HTTP/3 and it's underlying protocol QUIC
item.description: HTTP/3 and it’s underlying protocol QUIC talks about the new HTTP/3 layer and the underlying protocol QUIC. It’s from the very nice read by Daniel Haxx called HTTP/3 Explained â€“ which you should read as it details the processes, how it works and what the future holds for HTPP/3 and QUIC.

item.title: hoyt theme
item.description: Hoyt is a theme for Go Hugo with inspiration from Ben Hoyt’s personal website. It’s still a work in very slow progress but it was a very good starting point for me to learn about Go Hugo and how it works as a static site generator.

item.title: txt-from-img
item.description: txt-from-img was a gentle introduction to the tessaract library and how to get text from an image in a lambda function.

item.title: aiompesa
item.description: aiompesa is a Python library that I wrote which allows you to interact with Python’s asyncio library. MPESA is a service that allows you to make money transactions using your mobile phone. Asyncio is a library that allows you to write concurrent code in Python using async/await pattern.
